sen.e: After that, Kanei Tsuho was produced mostly in iron, and a great number of iron coins were minted in zeniza in Kameido, Fushimi, Ishinomaki and Ota City, Hatachi, Hatachi-no-kuni which were under direct control of kin-za.

sen.e: Copper coins were minted especially for international trade in Nagasaki after 1767, but their quality was poor.

sen.e: In 1821 zeniza in Hashiba, Asakusa started to mint Shimonsen coins, and after 1865 zeniza in Morioka, Sendai, Mito, Tsu City (Ise Province) and Hiroshima City (Aki Province) minted Shimonsen iron coins.

sen.j: 最初に原料である金属すなわち、銅、錫、鉛、および白目または白鑞（しろめ）（アンチモンまたはビスマスなど）を規定量秤りとり取組みが行われ、坩堝で鎔解されて合金がつくられる。

sen.e: Raw materials of 14 kan (unit of volume, approx.3.75 kg) were processed at a time as hitohuki (one blow), and the alloy thus produced was crashed, divided into lumps of 500 monme (a unit of weight, approx. 3.75 g) and sent to 銭吹所.

sen.j: 銭貨の原型である母銭は、手彫りにより製作された彫母銭を原型とし、彫母銭→錫母銭→銅母銭→通用銭という順で鋳写される工程が採られ、均質な銭貨が大量生産されるようになった。
sen.e: A matrix coin, which was a prototype of a coin, was made by using a hand-carved matrix coin, and mass production of homogeneous coins was made possible by the process of transcriptive molding from a carved matrix coin to a tin matrix coin, then to a copper matrix coin, and then to a coin in currency.
